docs.lead_paragraph: Requests for rate increases can be misleading, and some that look hefty now may turn out to be more modest once regulators weigh in.

headline.main: Understanding the Rate Increases for Health Care Plans

docs.snippet: Requests for rate increases can be misleading, and some that look hefty now may turn out to be more modest once regulators weigh in.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Widows of coal miners say they have been left to face the future on their own after an explosion and fire at a mine in Soma killed 301 men in May 2014.

headline.main: Anger and Grief Simmer in Turkey a Year After Soma Mine Disaster
headline.print_headline: Anguish One Year After a Mining Disaster in Turkey

docs.abstract: Elmadere Journal; widows of men killed in 2014 coal mine disaster in Soma, Turkey, some of whom live in town of Elmadere, say no one has been held accountable for disaster and that they are left to face future alone; anguish and anger among families around explosion and fire that killed 301 men remains high on one-year anniversary.
docs.snippet: Widows of coal miners say they have been left to face the future on their own after an explosion and fire at a mine in Soma killed 301 men in May 2014.

docs.lead_paragraph: The commonplace practice of billing rape victims in Louisiana for medical exams should come to an end after state lawmakers Tuesday signed off on proposed law changes that the federal government has required for a decade.

headline.main: Ban on Billing Rape Victims for Exams Passed by Legislature
headline.print_headline: Ban on Billing Rape Victims for Exams Passed by Legislature

docs.snippet: The commonplace practice of billing rape victims in Louisiana for medical exams should come to an end after state lawmakers Tuesday signed off on proposed law changes that the federal government has required for a decade.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former insurance broker who stole $10 million from Aetna Inc. by failing to submit health insurance premiums paid by a New Jersey university has pleaded guilty to fraud.

headline.main: Insurance Broker Pleads Guilty to Stealing $10M From Aetna
headline.print_headline: Insurance Broker Pleads Guilty to Stealing $10M From Aetna

docs.snippet: A former insurance broker who stole $10 million from Aetna Inc. by failing to submit health insurance premiums paid by a New Jersey university has pleaded guilty to fraud.

docs.lead_paragraph: The California Senate voted on Tuesday to allow unauthorized immigrants to buy health insurance on a state exchange created under the U.S. Affordable Care Act, a measure that would make the state the first to offer that kind of coverage.

headline.main: California Senate Votes to Let Undocumented Immigrants Buy Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: California Senate Votes to Let Undocumented Immigrants Buy Health Insurance

docs.snippet: The California Senate voted on Tuesday to allow unauthorized immigrants to buy health insurance on a state exchange created under the U.S. Affordable Care Act, a measure that would make the state the first to offer that kind of coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The California Senate on Tuesday approved legislation that would make the state the first in the nation to extend health coverage to children who are in the country illegally and seek federal authorization to sell private insurance to immigrants without documentation.

headline.main: California Considers Health Coverage for Immigrant Kids
headline.print_headline: California Considers Health Coverage for Immigrant Kids

docs.snippet: The California Senate on Tuesday approved legislation that would make the state the first in the nation to extend health coverage to children who are in the country illegally and seek federal authorization to sell private insurance to immigrants...

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 10 million people have signed up for private health insurance this year under President Barack Obama's law, the administration said Tuesday. That puts the nation finally within reach of coverage for all, but it may not last.

headline.main: More Than 10M Enrolled This Year Under Obama's Health Law
headline.print_headline: More Than 10M Enrolled This Year Under Obama's Health Law

docs.snippet: More than 10 million people have signed up for private health insurance this year under President Barack Obama's law, the administration said Tuesday. That puts the nation finally within reach of coverage for all, but it may not last.

docs.lead_paragraph: The makers of a pill intended to boost sexual desire in women will try again this week to persuade regulators that the drug warrants approval after two rejections.

headline.main: Concerns Remain for 'Viagra for Women' Twice Rejected by FDA
headline.print_headline: Concerns Remain for 'Viagra for Women' Twice Rejected by FDA

docs.snippet: The makers of a pill intended to boost sexual desire in women will try again this week to persuade regulators that the drug warrants approval after two rejections.
